thread.title: Man, Woman In Critical Condition After Pitcairn Shooting
thread.title_full: Man, Woman In Critical Condition After Pitcairn Shooting

author: CBS Pittsburgh
title: Man, Woman In Critical Condition After Pitcairn Shooting
text:
Man, Woman In Critical Condition After Pitcairn Shooting March 15, 2017 8:54 PM By Ralph Iannotti 
PITCAIRN (KDKA) — Two people are in critical condition after a double shooting Wednesday evening in Pitcairn. 
The crime scene is a small alley just off the 500-block of Broadway Avenue. 
Police and paramedics responded to the area around 8 p.m. after neighbors reported hearing gunfire. 
Officials say a man and a woman were shot there following some sort of a confrontation in Merchants Alley. Both victims were taken to the hospital and listed in critical condition. MORE BREAKING… At least one person reported critically wounded. Shooting took place in an alley off 500 block of Broadway. 
— Ralph Iannotti (@IannottiRalph) March 16, 2017 
The landlord of an apartment building next to the crime scene said the wounded man was the son of one of his tenants. 
He says that tenant told him about something that happened a couple of hours before the shooting that the landlord thinks may be most likely related to the double shooting. 
Lisa Washington’s Report: 
“I got a phone call from one of my tenants around 6 o’clock, saying that her son had been mugged and his wallet and house keys were taken,” Tom Barnishin, the landlord, said. 
Barnishin said the woman was fearful that the people who took the keys would return and come into the building, and she wanted the locks replaced. 
No suspects have been arrested. 
Stay with KDKA for the latest on this developing story.
